Title: GNU Wget: Header injection
Synopsis:
A header injection vulnerability in GNU Wget might allow remote
    attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers.

Background.Text: GNU Wget is a free software package for retrieving files using HTTP, HTTPS and FTP, the most widely-used Internet protocols.

Description.Text: It was discovered that there was a header injection vulnerability in GNU Wget which allowed remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers via CRLF sequences in the host subcomponent of a URL.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could inject arbitrary HTTP headers in requests by tricking a user running GNU Wget into processing crafted URLs.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All GNU Wget users should upgrade to the latest version:
